result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Correction from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.   Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.

No contact with Hollis M. or Dominos Pizza.
No contact with co-actors Darryl Gooden, Dekory Terrell, "Ashley" or "Brittney"
No controlled substances or alcohol.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes.
Court advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center only; good time allowed.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Schroeder out ill and requsted another date.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

/filed.

Defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed in custody.  Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DOMINO'S PIZZA, 7613 W GOOD HOPE RD.; HOLLICE M., DARRYL G., AND DEKORY T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tramaine Jovon Reed in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
